intro: Centaurea balsamitoides, commonly known as the Balsam Centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea balsamitoides is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
